notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat Virtualization Engine 4.4.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The ovirt-engine package provides the manager for virtualization environments.
This manager enables admins to define hosts and networks, as well as to add
storage, create VMs and manage user permissions.

A list of bugs fixed in this update is available in the Technical Notes
book:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_virtualization/4.4/html-single/technical_notes

Security Fix(es):

* nodejs-bootstrap-select: not escaping title values on <option> may lead to XSS (CVE-2019-20921)

* m2crypto: bleichenbacher timing attacks in the RSA decryption API (CVE-2020-25657)

* datatables.net: prototype pollution if 'constructor' were used in a data property name (CVE-2020-28458)

* nodejs-immer: prototype pollution may lead to DoS or remote code execution (CVE-2020-28477)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: bootstrap-select before 1.13.6 allows Cross-Site Scripting (XSS). It does not escape title values in OPTION elements. This may allow attackers to execute arbitrary JavaScript in a victim's browser.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: nodejs-bootstrap-select: not escaping title values on <option> may lead to XSS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: In OpenShift Service Mesh (OSSM) the openshift-service-mesh/kiali-rhel7 container (which installs the kiali rpm) is behind OpenShift OAuth authentication restricting access to the vulnerable bootstrap-select library to authenticated users only, therefore the impact is low.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/2974891

vulnerabilities.title: nodejs-bootstrap-select: not escaping title values on <option> may lead to XSS

notes.text: A flaw was found in all released versions of m2crypto, where they are vulnerable to Bleichenbacher timing attacks in the RSA decryption API via the timed processing of valid PKCS#1 v1.5 Ciphertext. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: m2crypto: bleichenbacher timing attacks in the RSA decryption API
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/2974891

vulnerabilities.title: m2crypto: bleichenbacher timing attacks in the RSA decryption API

notes.text: All versions of package datatables.net are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution due to an incomplete fix for https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-DATATABLESNET-598806.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: datatables.net: prototype pollution if 'constructor' were used in a data property name
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: OpenShift console container does package a vulnerable version of datatables.net, however as access to the vulnerable component is restricted via OpenShift OAuth the vulnerability is rated with an impact of `Low`.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/2974891

vulnerabilities.title: datatables.net: prototype pollution if 'constructor' were used in a data property name

cwe.name: Improperly Controlled Modification of Dynamically-Determined Object Attributes

notes.text: This affects all versions of package immer.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: nodejs-immer: prototype pollution may lead to DoS or remote code execution
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat Virtualization includes affected version of nodejs-immer, however the usage does not meet the conditions required to exploit the flaw, therefore the impact is Low.

In OpenShift Container Platform 4.6 (OCP) the openshift4/ose-prometheus container ships the vulnerable version of the nodejs-immer, however the Prometheus react-ui is disabled, hence this flaw cannot be exploited. As openshift4/ose-prometheus container still packages the vulnerable code, this component is affected with impact Low. This may be fixed in a future release.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/2974891
